page.title: 02Farming in Papa Westray
page.content: There are seventeen farms ranging from thirty acres to three hundred and thirty five acres, farmed by families who get most of their living off the land. {Crops }Most of the farms cultivate a few acres for oats, turnips and potatoes. All the farms make hay and eight also make silage for winter feed as most of the cattle are housed for six months in winter. {Animals }Beef cattle are bred on all the farms. Aberdeen Angus cows are crossed with continental breeds which can be obtained from an artificial insemmination group. Six farms keep sheep, mostly North Country Cheviots crossed with Suffolk, the lambs being sold in October, or November.In one farm Shetland Ewes are crossed with Suffolk.No horses have been used in twenty years.
